wikipedia_page.main: Alan Edwin Thomas Harper,  (born 20 March 1944) is a retired Anglican bishop. He served in the Church of Ireland as Archbishop of Armagh and Primate of All Ireland from 2007 to 2012.He was the second English-born primate since the Disestablishment of the Church of Ireland in 1869. He and his wife Helen have four children.

response: On 10 January 2007, the 11 serving bishops of the Church of Ireland, meeting at St Patrick's Cathedral in Dublin, elected Alan Harper, Bishop of Connor, as Eames's successor.
* The Most Reverend Alan Harper, Archbishop of Armagh (Head of the Church of Ireland) from 2007–12
*Alan Harper (politician) (born 1957), member of the Alabama House of Representatives

| 60px Alan HarperDiocese of Armagh: Alan Harper. Retrieved 23 January 2009.

In 2012, he was elected, in succession to Alan Harper, to be the Archbishop of Armagh and Primate of All Ireland. His translation to Armagh took effect on 15 December 2012, on which date he also was enthroned at St Patrick's Cathedral.Church of Ireland: Clarke elected as Archbishop, ireland.anglican.org; accessed 27 July 2017.
